page.title: 10THE SHIP INN AT LEVINGTON
page.content: The Ship Inn was built in the 14th Century near Levington Creek. The village used to be here but the survivors of the Black Death built a new village further away. The Ship Inn used to be two cottages. Before it was called The Ship, it was known as The Tankard. It had a long tradition of smuggling and inside there is a smuggler's cupboard. It got its name because it was built from ship's timbers. It has only been passed down to two families in the last 70 years. The Ship Inn has recently been extended, but it is still a traditional Pub. Before the extension it was very small indeed. It now serves food which is prepared without any micro-wave ovens. It is the only Pub in the village. It is popular with locals and people in the surrounding areas.
